result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan Richard White

defendant.name: White, Ryan Richard
defendant.address: E4235 County Road BB, Menomonie, WI 54751

records.addlTxt:
Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license or an IID.

1:50 PM Apprs: Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann for S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Ryan Richard White in court.  Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin.  DE states he does have an attorney and would like to reschedule this matter for a different date and time his Atty could be here.  Court will set bond only and reschedules INIT for next week. Adjourned at 1:51 PM. bph
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
